type.name: org.gradle.api.tasks.javadoc.Javadoc
type.description:
Generates HTML API documentation for Java classes.

If you create your own Javadoc tasks remember to specify the 'source' property! Without source the Javadoc task will not create any documentation. Example: 

 
 apply plugin: 'java' 
 
 task myJavadocs(type: Javadoc) { 
   source = sourceSets.main.allJava 
 }

An example how to create a task that runs a custom doclet implementation: 

 
 apply plugin: 'java' 
 
 configurations { 
   jaxDoclet 
 } 
 
 dependencies { 
   //jaxDoclet "some.interesting:Dependency:1.0" 
 } 
 
 task generateRestApiDocs(type: Javadoc) { 
   source = sourceSets.main.allJava 
   destinationDir = reporting.file("rest-api-docs") 
   options.docletpath = configurations.jaxDoclet.files.asType(List) 
   options.doclet = "com.lunatech.doclets.jax.jaxrs.JAXRSDoclet" 
   options.addStringOption("jaxrscontext", "http://localhost:8080/myapp") 
 }

method.name: getClasspath
method.description:
Returns the classpath to use to resolve type references in the source code.

returns:The classpath.

method.name: getDestinationDir
method.description:
Returns the directory to generate the documentation into.



returns:The directory.

method.name: getExecutable
method.description:
Returns the Javadoc executable to use to generate the Javadoc. When null, the Javadoc executable for the current JVM is used.

returns:The executable. May be null.

method.name: getMaxMemory
method.description: Returns the amount of memory allocated to this task.

method.name: getOptions
method.description:
Returns the Javadoc generation options.

returns:The options. Never returns null.

method.name: getTitle
method.description:
Returns the title for the generated documentation.



returns:The title, possibly null.

method.name: getToolChain
method.description: Returns the tool chain that will be used to generate the Javadoc.

method.name: isFailOnError
method.description: Specifies whether this task should fail when errors are encountered during Javadoc generation. When true, this task will fail on Javadoc error. When false, this task will ignore Javadoc errors.

method.name: isVerbose
method.description:
Returns whether Javadoc generation is accompanied by verbose output.
@see #setVerbose(boolean)

method.name: options
method.description:
Convenience method for configuring Javadoc generation options.
param:block The configuration block for Javadoc generation options.

method.name: setClasspath
method.description:
Sets the classpath to use to resolve type references in this source code.
param:classpath The classpath. Must not be null.

method.name: setDestinationDir
method.description: Sets the directory to generate the documentation into.

method.name: setMaxMemory
method.description:
Sets the amount of memory allocated to this task.
param:maxMemory The amount of memory

method.name: setOptions
method.description:
Sets the Javadoc generation options.
param:options The options. Must not be null.

method.name: setTitle
method.description: Sets the title for the generated documentation.

method.name: setToolChain
method.description: Sets the tool chain to use to generate the Javadoc.

method.name: setVerbose
method.description:
Sets whether Javadoc generation is accompanied by verbose output or not. The verbose output is done via println (by the underlying Ant task). Thus it is not handled by our logging.
param:verbose Whether the output should be verbose.

property.name: classpath
property.description:
Returns the classpath to use to resolve type references in the source code.

returns:The classpath.

property.name: destinationDir
property.description:
Returns the directory to generate the documentation into.



returns:The directory.

property.name: executable
property.description:
Returns the Javadoc executable to use to generate the Javadoc. When null, the Javadoc executable for the current JVM is used.

returns:The executable. May be null.

property.name: failOnError
property.description: Specifies whether this task should fail when errors are encountered during Javadoc generation. When true, this task will fail on Javadoc error. When false, this task will ignore Javadoc errors.

property.name: maxMemory
property.description: Returns the amount of memory allocated to this task.

property.name: options
property.description:
Returns the Javadoc generation options.

returns:The options. Never returns null.

property.name: title
property.description:
Returns the title for the generated documentation.



returns:The title, possibly null.

property.name: toolChain
property.description: Returns the tool chain that will be used to generate the Javadoc.

property.name: verbose
property.description:
Returns whether Javadoc generation is accompanied by verbose output.
@see #setVerbose(boolean)
